Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Patrick D
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the good reviews posted on TripAdvisor. No bad surprise and staff were extremely helpful and nice. We got a family room, with kitchenette, fridge and microwave oven and it was very functional and clean. Breakfast was included in our price and it was fresh and of good quality. We recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended us this hotel and we booked it for 7 days. This is a quality hotel, located in the center of Paris, close to subway and in a safe area. We found there many shops and good restaurants. The frontdesk staff were particularly helpful and nice. Our room (located in the backyard) was clean,comfortable and quiet, with free Wifi. We will go back there for our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for spending your vacations”
Reviews.Author: Murray J
Reviews.Content: Central location, close to subway, pleasant area with good restaurants and shops. Our family room was quiet, clean and well equipped (with kitchenette). We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica T
Reviews.Content: We spent several days in this very pleasant hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. Everything was excellent : our room was quiet, clean and well equipped (with free Wifi and a courtesy tray for making coffee) - breakfast was fresh and tasty - And the location is quite convenient for visiting Paris sights. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good with reasonable price for Paris centre”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel owing to the positive reviews found on this site. Well, they are quite objective and i was really please with my room and the central location of the hotel. The pluses are the free Wifi and the courtesy tray that you can find in the room. Also, there are many channels in English on TV. I would definitely recommend it to my friends that are to visit Paris pretty soon!

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting hotel, tiny room...”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousMonaco
Reviews.Content: Only two drawbacks: 1: My room was so small (the bed filled it almost completely) that I needed to push the bed against the bathroom door in order to open my suitcase. Then, in order to enter the bathroom, I needed to close my suitcase, upend it, and push the bed back to its original position! 2: The bed was rather uncomfortable. Plus points: Pleasant staff, attractive decor, wifi, iphone docking station, well-stocked courtesy tray and mini-bar. Given the hotel's location near Gare de Lyon, I will stay there again but will ask for a bigger room or a smaller bed next time.

Reviews.Title: “A very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Kathy F
Reviews.Content: We spend a few days in this hotel and eveything was top : the service, the breakfast food quality, the cleanliness of our room, the central location (close to subway and convenient for sightseeing), the staff. We will go back there for our next trip scheduled this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: Kevin P
Reviews.Content: I spend a few days in this hotel for business purposes and i really enjoyed it. Free wifi is available and my room was quiet and well equipped. The hotel is close to "Gare de Lyon" train station and to the subway. You can find several good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Shelter from the storm”
Reviews.Author: MAWukfr
Reviews.Content: It's been a year since I stayed here but I forgot to write the review. Dec 2010 was chaos from a travelling POV with all the snow etc. My wife found this hotel and book last minute for me as I was stranded in Paris and what a find. It's great, a real shelter from the storm. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. Paris is full of shoddy, dirty 3 * hotels and this is NOT one of them. The staff were very helpful. Everything was clean, oil's in a great location to base yourself to vist this great city or to do business or just stoop off for 1 night. The owner even showed me the family room for future stays and it looked great for a family of 4, which is gold in this city. It was fully booked when I returned last year - so it must be good. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as expected”
Reviews.Author: Henry S
Reviews.Content: Some business colleagues recommended this hotel and the service was excellent as expected. Free Wifi was available in my room and it was clean and quiet for working. Breakfast was really good, made with fresh food. I will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Philip M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really like described in the differents reviews and websites. No bad surprise, good atmosphere, nice renovation, friendly staff and central location. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on tripadvisor and it really deserves the good reviews. My room was very clean and quiet (in the backyard) and the area is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick H
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - Staff were really helpful and nice - Our family room was large with a kitchenette and courtesy tray (for coffee, tea). Also, the area is quite safe and with many shops. We will return for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, nice renovation”
Reviews.Author: Peter T
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. The hotel is in a safe and pleasant area. Breakfast was excellent. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Josh B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located, close to Gare de Lyon train station & the subway. You have free Wifi in the room with English TV channels. Staff are polite and friendly. Also, there are many good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary H
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel deserves all the good reviews posted here. No bad surprise and it is as showed on the website pictures. I will go back there for my next visit of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Charles M
Reviews.Content: We booking a Juniior Suite in this hotel and it was really comfortable and clean, facing the backyard, with a small terrace. We enjoyed staying there, since it was ideally located for visiting the different points of interest. Also, breakfast was really good (with excellent croissants and baguette) and staff were friendly and spoke good English. Finally, we booked the hotel shuttle service for a reasonable price and this was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A nice play to spend the week-end”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: We spent a week-end in this hotel and were more than happy! Staff were helpful and friendly, our room was very clean and well equipped and breakfast was excellent, with variety and fresh food. It is also conveniently located for visiting the main spots.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy K
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Tripadvisor and i don't regret it! It is really as described in the different reviews : excellent value for money, very clean, polite staff and centrally located. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fred D
Reviews.Content: Great staff, big and clean room, free Wifi, central location, excellent breakfast included in price. This hotel is worth its 3 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Roylene1
Reviews.Content: Four members of my family stayed here for 8 nights in late Dec.2011 & early Jan.2011 and everything about the hotel was great. The Bastille Area had great restaurants & several metro stops. It is non-touristy and safe.Mohammed, at the front desk, was very helpful, and made the hotel special.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline B
Reviews.Content: Well located and close to Gare de Lyon also Gare de Bercy for putting the car on the train. The staff were very friendly and the room was warm and cosy. Excellent choice of breakfast and did not have to vacate the room before midday. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Loved everything about it and could have happily stayed two or three days. Long may it last!

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 kids and we spent a week in a Junior Suite. It was spacy, with a kitchenette and mini-fridge.All the hotel was really clean and the staff were polite. The location is quite central and ideal for visiting Paris. We could find some good restaurants in the area and we enjoyed are stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel i recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lorinda M
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel and i really recommend it. You can find comfort and modern amenities (like Wifi, satellite TV, courtesy tray for coffee...). Staff were very polite and helpful. Breakfast was excellent with a variety of fresh food and beverages. Last, location is very central and close to subway (5 minutes walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Harry C
Reviews.Content: We spend several days at this hotel and we were really pleased with the service, the decoration, the amenities (free Wifi in room) and also the breakfast. The location is quite central and you can take the subway to go to the main sites. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: Fred H
Reviews.Content: We booked a family suite in this hotel and it was really a good deal. The suite is quite large and includes a kitchenette and a courtesy tray (for tea/coffee). Staff were particularly friendly and helpful. Location is central (close to subway) and the area is plesant and safe. We will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good renovation, good location”
Reviews.Author: George L
Reviews.Content: I spent the week-end in this hotel and it looks just like what you can see on the pictures : renovated, warm atmosphere and friendly staff. My room was on the top floor on a quiet part and it was extremely clean and well decorated. Free Wifi was more than welcome and the location is perfect for visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elisa R
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 kids and we booked a Junior Suite in this hotel. It was above our expections : freshly renovated room with free Wifi & courtesy tray (for making coffee). Breakfast was a buffet with a wide variety of fresh food. Also, the location is ideal for sightseeing (close to subway and within walking distance of "Le Marais" area). We will probably go back for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole O
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights there for business purposes and i found the staff very professional (helped me send & receive faxes, gave me the Wifi access code upon arrival,...). Also this hotel is located in a pleasant neighborhood where you can find many good restaurants. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for spending the week-end”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: We spent last week-end in this hotel and we were pleased. Free Wifi and courtesy tray in the room, central location, excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Central location - Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan C
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after the recommendations of my friends and i really enjoyed staying there : the location is quite central (close to subway and train station for going to the South of France), the area looks typically Parisian (with stoned buildings) - Also staff were very friendly and helped me find good restaurants and points of interest. I will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, too bad for the beds”
Reviews.Author: m1st3ryGu3st
Reviews.Content: After staying @ Disney we went to this very, very charming hotel. Very friendly staff, very cosy reception, and it looked neat. We had room 502 on top floor. WOW what a charming room. Clean toilet and superb shower! Who gad expected this in a 3 star hotel in Paris? After diner finally went to bed.... Big bummer. The matrasses were very hard and sleeping on it was not that comfy at all. I know this is very personal, but i'm used to hard matresses, but this one was really not comfy. Next morning we had to wait 5 minutes before elevator arrived, only to find out that breakfastroom was full. After few minutes we could take our seats. Breakfast was good if you are used the prices in Paris.... Only readon not to go back is bevause of the beds. And if you decide to book a room, ask for a room AWAY from the elevator.... It makes a lot of NoIsE :-(

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very central (close to "Bastille" main subway stop and at 3 blocks from "Gare de Lyon" train station). I was quite impressed by the cleanliness of my room and of the building in general. I will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacky O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business reasons and i really enjoyed it. You can find free Wifi in the room and also a very practical iPhone docking station. Staff are very helpful (made some restaurant reservations for me) and the breakfast is really good. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel through different positive reviews and they were right : this hotel is just great with very friendly staff. We spent a couple of days and during the whole stay, we felt like home. Our room was cozy, clean and quiet (facing the inner yard) and we also appreciated getting Wifi for free. Also, the area is pleasant and safe and conveniently located (close to subxay and local shops). We definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent a week in the hotel and we were really pleased. The staff were particularly friendly and helpful (for finding restaurants and directions to main points of interest) and our room was large and very clean. Though the breakfast room was a lttle bit tight, we enjoyed the croissants and fresh food. Last, the location is central (close to subway) and in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by our firends and we spent a week for our first visit to Paris.We really appreciated the central location (close to subway and points of interest). Also the staff were friendly and could speak good English. Our room was clean and well equipped (free Wifi, courtesy tray for tea/coffee). Last, we used the airport shuttle service that was convenient and time! We will definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vic E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pavillon Saint Louis Bastille for four nights. The hotel is well located in the Marais, is clean and has character. But the real value in this hotel is the staff, who are outstanding. Our train to Toulouse was cancelled because of a strike on the day we were due to board it. The two young women on the reception desk went out of their way to help us book a rental car so we could drive there.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Alwayshappytogo
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room, but the lady receptionist kindly upgraded to a double room for single use, free of charge. My room was very nice with all modern amenities (a/c, minibar, shower/bath tub, hairdryer, a flatscreen TV which allows convenient viewing either in bed or from the bathroom, with French and international channels); very quiet, with a partial view of the small patio; and very clean. This was my first stay in this area, and as I was fortunate to arrive on a Sunday morning, I could enjoy the lively MarchÃ© d'Aligre almost just around the corner. It's an easy stroll to designer shops, restaurants and bars, to the Promenade PlantÃ©e, the Opera Bastille and Le Marais; and at least three different metro lines and interesting RATP-bus lines for sightseeing (among them, two different itineraries to the Eiffel Tower) are within easy reach. Sure, there are more fashionable areas in Paris than this one, but I liked the feeling of a "normal" neighbourhood, in contrast to the business oriented or overly tourist run areas elsewhere in Paris. During one of my walks I had the opportunity to visit the Hotel Saint-Louis, located in the main street of the Ile Saint-Louis, which is of similar design and may be or have been under the same management (same style of exterior and interior decoration, and a very polite receptionist as well).

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed and fluffy pillows :)”
Reviews.Author: Kiky T
Reviews.Content: Pros: Small but comfy hotel! Room 402 was nice.. small but fit my best friend and i. Shower worked a treat and room was very clean. Close to Gare De Lyon train station and many nice restaurants in the Bastille area. Spent the first 3 nights in room 402 but then changed to room 11 after my friend left and the room is much bigger with a double bed. Breakfast was very good.. fresh croissants and fresh fruit salad. Customer service was 110% as i would often ask about where to eat and tourist info etc. Free wireless internet in everyroom was perfect! Cons: The airconditioning in 402 worked fine but becuase the room was so small soon after you fall asleep you freeze.. when its off you suffocate lol. I guess this only applies if you travel in summer! The days i was in Paris was the hottest week in Autumn in a long time! Room 11's A/C worked but was very noisy. Thank god i travel with earplugs :)

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and clean!”
Reviews.Author: nicsteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pavillion Saint Louis for 4 nights. Three of us traveling, we were in room 10 on the main floor. As a previous review stated that the room was noisy, I felt this was somewhat true. Yes, you do hear a fair amount of noise. I am a light sleeper, but I was so exhausted from our travels that I pretty much slept thru it. Room 11 is next to the elevator, so I would assume the noise would be much more apparent in that room. Room 10 was great for us, very roomy. Door out to the courtyard where we would sit and relax with a bottle of wine after a long day. The hotel is very clean, our room was clean and the bathroom was clean. Plenty of towels for 3 people. All of the desk employees were very nice & pleasant. Breakfast was your usual fair. Pastries, meats, cheeses, fruit, juice, coffee/tea, cereal. Just enough to get you on your way for the day. Location nice, in a neighborhood. About 2-3 block walk to the river Seine. If coming from the airport, take the metro, about 9-10 euros. Probably the least expensive mode of transportation and will take you about an hour. Not fun if you have a lot of luggage though. 1-2 bags should be ok. On the metro, take the B line to Gare du Nord. Hop on 4 (d'Orleans) to Saint-Denis. Then hop on the 8 (Creteil) to Ledru Rollin. (dont quote me on this, check route on map to be sure) When you come up top, you will see a McDonalds. Look for the "Laboratoire" store front. The street to the right of the "Laboratoire" is Ledru Rollin. The streets are confusing, many diagonal directions (duh...Paris). Head down Ledru Rollin about 2-3 blocks and you will see rue de Charenton. There is a laundry on one corner, bistro on another corner and bakery on another corner. Hotel is across street from laundry on Charenton. I would stay here again. Good luck and be patient!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, if you don't go for a ground floor room”
Reviews.Author: Alyosha A A
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel for one night only after reading all the positive reviews. The location is great and very convenient. The hotel itself is a very nice, small and cosy boutique hotel. The rooms are small but with the great character. Overall, I would have agreed with all the previous reviews and would give the hotel 5 out of 5 if only we did not get the room on the ground floor (room 10 and 11). Very simple: you can hear every single thing from the reception and the room next door in particular. In our case this meant â€“ loud chatting, laughing and shouting until 2am. I called the reception at midnight, asking for earplugs (and I am not being dramatic, the noise is very loud!) and been told that they donâ€™t have any (I donâ€™t think that the management is unaware how loud the ground floor gets, so buying the earplugs for Â£1 could be a good idea!). Then we asked to change the room, no luck. The last thing I asked was to keep the noise down at least after the midnight, and was told that they would try. Not to blame anyone, but after having 2 sleepless nights in a row, we could not care less for the hotels charm and character.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mjna
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here! We had a quad room for 2 adults and 2 teens which was plenty big enough, (although the loo was rather small). Everything was clean and the decor was attractive. All the staff at the front desk and at breakfast (which was delicious!) were very friendly and helpful. Good, convenient location, too. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely big rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrsBee21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely refurbished little hotel last weekend and were really impressed. Our family room was massive, spotlessly clean, and the little kitchenette was a real bonus. The daytime receptionist and the lady who serves breakfast are friendly and helpful and are very patient with those of us determined to improve our French (the gentleman on reception speaks excellent English too)! Choices at breakfast time are very good and although the room is small, we got a table easily each morning. Ledru Rollin and Gare de Lyon stations are less than a 10 minute walk away and you can be in the centre of town within 15 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes close by as well as a nice toy shop and a corner shop (where you can pick up a pint of milk if you're missing your English cuppas like I was!). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jopurtill
Reviews.Content: We found this a perfect place to spend 4 nights to explore Paris. The hotel is well situated and it an easy walk to two metro stations, from which you can get anywhere!! Short stroll away are supermarkets, grocery shops, bistros and bars. The hotel decor is charming and we were lucky to have a front room with two large windows. There was no street noise problem at night. The rooms were very clean and kept in excellent condition. The sone corridors and atmospheric art work was charming. The only negative if any was breakfast. The breakfast room is very small and although we got a table every morning straight away, some guests didn't. Once in and seated, it could sometimes be a struggle to get in and out which made nipping up to the buffet difficult. The choice was limited for those that do not want to eat tons of bread and pastry in the morning!! Only two cereals, a bit of fruit and yoghurt to chose from. The croissants and bread were supplied by an attentive waiter to each table and were not part of the buffet selection. It seems far too much of these were put in the basket fir two people. We would have preferred less breads and more alternative other stuff. The staff were attentive, friendly and helpful. I would certainly go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Very small, unkind staff”
Reviews.Author: Machia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days. This hotel is overpriced. Staffs were unkind and unhelpful. A bed was uncomfortable. Towels were not fresh so we did not use them for faces. They are like those found in very cheap gym. Included breakfast was good. We used another hotel which has the same price near the Triumph Arch. This was much better.

Reviews.Title: “very impressive!”
Reviews.Author: TheBanster
Reviews.Content: This place does everything very well. I normally stay in a 2 star hotel when in Paris but wanted somewhere near the Gare de Lyon train station to help with heavy luggage and train connections to the south of France and I got a good deal on the internet. This is the place for that scenario. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near the centre”
Reviews.Author: Maxtheviper
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was lovely and room clean and modern. Very convenient position and good price too.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel. Beautiful decor and excellent staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHensley
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small and friendly. It is decorated to a very high standard, the rooms were airy and well equipped, with mini bar, ipod docking station, tv and tea and coffee. The bathroom was immaculate and again equipped to a very high standard. Breakfast was served in the restaurant, the choice was extensive and everything was fresh. Perfect for a stay in Paris, ideal location 5 minutes from Gard de Lyon and 5 miniutes to the Bastille for the metroline.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to top this One”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTraveller099
Reviews.Content: The Pavillon Saint Louis Bastille is a lovely small hotel a few blocks from the Gare de Lyon, very convenient to the Metro, RER from CDG airport, and to the SNCF. The beds are very comfortable, there is flat screen TV (with six channels including CNN), a full bath, and provision for separate twin beds if desired. The petite dejeuner was The was more generious than eany I have ever seen, offering hard boiled eggs, two kinds of yogurt, two forms of dry cerial, three kinds of fruit juice, baguettes, brioches, etc, three kinds of cheese, two kinds of sliced meats, coffee, tea, hot water -fruit cocktail, plus a choice apples and oranges, all served buffet style. The air conditioning worked well. The linens were changed daily. There was wi-fi in the rooms and a computer with printer in the lobby. All for E 185 per night, all included.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, ideally located for visiting the City. Staff excellent.”
Reviews.Author: GuildfordTravelbug59
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a wedding anniversary treat for my sister and brother in law (who is French). They live in the South and were not expecting such a gem in central Paris. They felt the staff could not have been more helpful, the room was clean, if a little small (not city people, never stayed in city hotels before!) Their only complaint was the lights outside their window (did I mention not city people?!). They had a fabulous stay and wanted to thank the hotel for making their 20th wedding anniversary something special. We had explained to the hotel that we were paying and they were very helpful in allowing us to do this over the phone. We will definitely use this hotel again when staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: r2e3
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel with updated furnishing and decor! Looks exactly like the photos on bookings.com! Typical Paris size rooms but close to Metro and great restaurants! Delicious breakfast and great staff! Very helpful staff! I would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again when we go back to Paris! We traveled with 3 young kids and it was a good size room. Also helped that a toy store was located directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 star hotel we've ever stayed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JNewton79
Reviews.Content: It was our first time at Pavillon Saint-Louis Bastille and we definitely don't regret it! The hotel looks exactly as in the pictures on their website and the rooms (though not huge) are extremely well equipped and newly refurbished. You can get free Wifi in the room and also a complimentary coffee/tea maker. We had breakfast every day and it is really excellent (those fresh croissants & baguettes are really a plus!). This hotel is really the best value for money for downtown Paris. We really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to enjoy Paris Don't book in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: YasirRuhaily
Reviews.Content: Extremely small room, no space for your bags, you will feel that you are sleeping in the street and you will hear any single noise. Very small lobby if it's existing ! The reviews and the photos doesn't reflect the reality. The door of bathroom doesn't close easy because it's stuck to stony floor. I felt during my stay for only 12 hours like I was in jail by 159 Euro! I will not recommend this hotel even for my enemies. The only thing I like is the receptionist, helpful and friendly. I doubt if this hotel can deserve one single star

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: nsolas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February, 2011, arriving on a cold and windy Paris evening. Delays in registration. Staff generally unhelpful. Lobby small. Room furnishings shabby, do not match quality seen in photos. Noises between rooms. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and local”
Reviews.Author: KIChef
Reviews.Content: I really liked this B&B. The neighborhood is interesting and very local. There is an open-air market nearby and nice small streets for taking a stroll. Not too close to the metro, but not more than 15 minutes either. I picked it to be close to the Gare de Lyon without being in an area where sleep isn't possible. I also wrote to them and asked if I could check in early for some sleep after my red-eye .. and they accommodated me with no problem. The rooms are small, and the shower hand-held .. but this is Europe after all!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: KerryRose
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel excellent. The staff were lovely and helped us book tours and gave us directions to where we wished to go. The rooms were spotless and breakfast was very good. The only negative was the rooms were too hot to sleep comfortably, even in late October but it didn't really matter because everything else was so good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice...Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Cfpscott
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a good location! Appears to be recently remodeled. The staff was quite helpful. No issues with noise.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Klesley
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a one-night stay because of its nearness to the Gare de Lyon, the price and the good reviews. It was a good choice. Firstly, our taxi driver had phoned ahead so that the receptionist was waiting for us and took our cases straight out of the car into the hotel. Our keys were ready and we were shown directly to our room. The room itself was a reasonable size, nicely decorated and had a balcony to sit out on. I had asked for a quiet room so it was at the back of the hotel away from the road - not much of a view but really quiet. Spotlessly clean too. I'm not sure about wi-fi as we didn't have a laptop with us, but there's a PC in the lobby which we could use for free. Distance from the Gare de Lyon was about 7mins on foot so really quick to get to. The area around the hotel has lots of cafes, restaurants and patisseries, lots of decent places to eat as the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. But they do a great breakfast! A small hotel but perfectly formed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but right next to noisy bar”
Reviews.Author: Polarbjorn
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, in good area - however, the hotel is next to a *very* noisy bar which plays audible music until 5am on the Friday night we stayed. Speaking to the night portier, this does not seem to be unusual as he knew immediately that it would go on until 5am and that there were no rooms spared from the noise (base sounds from bar which could be heard on the 4th floor, all along the corridor). A real shame, since the room itself was small but nice and breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rustycoelho
Reviews.Content: I know this is late, but I stayed at the Pavillion, back in March and had a WONDERFUL experience! I was the leader of a group of 11. The staff was most professional and gracious. My room, though tiny, was well appointed and charming. It was clean and the decor was pleasing. Breakfast was fabulous! The concierge was helpful with directions and making dinner reservations for us. It was nice to come "home" to the hotel after long days of lecturing and touring the sights of Paris. I loved it. I will most surely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - little room”
Reviews.Author: cece714
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 500. We booked it as a room for 3 people. It was not really suitable for 3. There was plenty of room for 2. The added bed was in the small space just wide enough to fit the bed and some of the bed was under the desk. The bed blocked the closet and the fridge and there was no room to walk around the extra bed. The bathroom was large and the shower was great. The tiled floor was very nice. The service at the hotel was fantastic. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and reservations for the hop on hop off bus. The breakfast and breakfast staff was wonderful. The area around the hotel was quiet and there were a few restaurants and a corner store. The walk from Gare Lyon was easy and the staff was very helpful in getting us from Gare Nord to Gare Lyon and then to the hotel. Their English was great. We would recommend this hotel, but make sure if you're booking for more than 2 people to ask for a room with a pull out sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with room, location, service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CanberraIan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good area, near tube station, Gare de Lyon, restaurants and a 25 min pleasant walk to Notre Dame where we caught the Hop-on Hop-off tourist bus. Very impressed with room, clean, elegant/modern and with french decor, mini kitchen, large bathroom, LCD in bedroom and lounge. Breakfast was great - especially loved the crusty fresh french bread, croissants and pastries. Staff very helpful and no communication issues. We organised the airport pickup and couldn't have had a more helpful driver. He drove us to the airpot medical centre located in another terminal when my wife unexpectedly required a doctor. He then waited and later drove us to the hotel - what service!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, affordable, friendly and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Parisajamais
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel we have been searching for for all these years: cozy, quiet, friendly, good neighborhood as well as nice amenities made for a lovely 10-day stay. The breakfast room is very attractive and the breakfast itself was quite good. We especially appreciated the closet space. We enjoyed being able to have tea in our room as well. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: gaudiantonio62
Reviews.Content: Very good location in downtown Paris - Staff always willing to help and very nice - Room small (but that's Paris!) but functional - Excellent breakfast for a 3 star hotel. Rooms quite small, but nice design. Lovely bathroom. The owners were utterly friendly! It was in a perfect area for us. Was as good as we hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Thiny, but charming”
Reviews.Author: AdrianMS
Reviews.Content: - Small hotel, but cosy. - Very good breakfast. - Clean and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A well priced gem near the Seinne”
Reviews.Author: kiwi500
Reviews.Content: Price included a great traditional French breakfast. Rooms small but comfortable and modern. Good location off the main tourist trail but only a 5 min walk to the Seine. Only down side was lack of assistance with good ways to see Paris e.g.day passes on metro or the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: raff40035
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Paris several times and always look for a reasonably priced hotel. I have to say this was the best I HAVE FOUND SO FAR. The location was excellent situated 5 mins walk from the lively Bastille and Marais districts. Room was comfartable and well equipped with a fantastic shower (Room 401) Blackout curtains meant a fantastic nights sleep. It's only a 5 - 10 minute walk from Gare de Lyon station which was handy for our early morning TGV to Avignon in the morning. We hope to be back next year

Reviews.Title: “Very nice "off the beaten track" hotel”
Reviews.Author: AC95133
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in this 3 star hotel and honestly it was above my expectations : - the room was comfortable and quiet - the breakfast excellent with fresh croissants and a large choice - the restaurants in the area with good quality for value - very safe area for nightlife

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: R951753
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel and it was above my expectations. The staff was particularly friendly at helping me finding good restaurants and night clubs in the area (this was my first visit in Paris). My single room was cozy , clean and quiet with flatscreen TV and English channels (thanks God! My French is terrible) and the supplied kettle with tea was more than welcome and unexpected... The location of the hotel is indeed pleasant with many shops and closed to the Tube ("Metro"). I will recommend this hotel to my friends that plan a visit in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully refurbished..”
Reviews.Author: wellensian
Reviews.Content: Between the Gare de Lyon and the Bastille, the hotel is on a quietish street and reasonably convenient for catching an early morning train. Hardly noticeable from outside, the first sight of the interior immediately tells you that the hotel has been beautifully and expensively refurbished, while retaining its Parisian character (miniscule lift and breakfast area off the reception). Best of all the room was welcoming, decorated with great imagination in calming colours and inteligent use of the comparatively limited space that a single room offers. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom excellent. The accommodation gave very good value, and included breakfast (bread, crossiants etc). The St Antoine area is less than thrilling, and a walk in the rain to find somwhere to eat was less rewarding than in some parts of Paris, but I would certainly stay in this hotel again for comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “the sort of gem that is disappearing fast”
Reviews.Author: galloping_grannie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the very busy night of Nuit Blanche. A small friendly Parisian hotel that doesn't cost the earth - so many have called themselves 'boutique hotels'and doubled their rates! Rooms are understated and stylish with old prints and orginal doors and windows. Modern bathrooms. Spotlessly clean. My bedroom opened onto the central courtyard so was very quiet (no traffic noise at all). The reception staff and the lovely housekeeper were wonderful. The breakfast room was full when I went to breakfast at peak time on Sunday but they let me take a tray piled high with goodies up to my room, and the coffee, bread and croissants were excellent. Wonderfully convenient near Bastille and a short walk from Gare de Lyon. A delightful Parisien neighbourhood with real shopsand real people. I look forward to returning.

HotelInfo.Name: Pavillon Saint Louis Bastille
HotelInfo.Address: 66 Rue de Charenton | 12 Arr., 75012 Paris, France
